creator: julle@diku.dk
text:
A filename that is like a filename that should be handled by an external
program, but has a dot after gets sent to the other apllication.

ie.
If a file is named info.php.OLD it gets sent to php even though the suffix given
in AddType is .php

This a severe security risk for any system that lets people upload files, since
a check for .php endings aren't enough.

Ok, so right now somebody sent me this link:
http://httpd.apache.org/docs/mod/mod_mime.html#multipleext

In my opinion it's still a bug that files like .php. and .php.whatever gets sent
to php even if whatever is not a valid type.
creator: julle@diku.dk

text:
Not a bug per documentation - closing.

Thanks for using Apache HTTP Server!
creator: jerenkrantz@apache.org
